name: Chiles en Nogada
description: A renowned Mexican dish featuring poblano chiles stuffed with picadillo (a mixture of meat, fruits, and spices), topped with a walnut-based cream sauce and pomegranate seeds.
steps: Roast poblano peppers, peel off the skin, and remove seeds.
Prepare the picadillo by cooking ground meat with tomatoes, apples, pears, and peaches.
Stuff the roasted chiles with the picadillo.
Prepare a sauce by blending walnuts with milk, sugar, and sherry until smooth.
Cover the stuffed chiles with the walnut cream sauce.
Garnish with pomegranate seeds and parsley before serving.
tips: Char the poblano peppers evenly for easy peeling.
Cool the picadillo before stuffing to prevent tearing the chiles.
The dish can be served at room temperature, enhancing its flavors.
equipment: oven or grill for roasting peppers
